GIVEN the user is on MLB.com home page

-Beta: https://beta-aws.mlb.com (Beta cookie/credentials needed prior for environment access)
custom_steps:
WHEN clicking on MLB.tv icon next to game displays

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19742)

IF user is logged in
custom_expected:
THEN the user should be redirected to MLB.TV video page appropriately
-Prod: https://www.mlb.com/tv
-Beta: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/tv

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19775)


OR ELSE if not logged in

title: Sign On - Yearly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has a yearly entitled account
AND users have navigated to a live streamed game (Preview and In Progress states)
custom_steps: WHEN users sign into their yearly entitled account
custom_expected: THEN users will be able to access the live stream.

title: Sign On - Monthly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has a yearly entitled account
AND users have navigated to a live streamed game (Preview and In Progress states)
custom_steps: WHEN the user signs in with their monthly entitled account
custom_expected: THEN users will be able to access the stream

title: Sign On - Single Team
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has a Single Team entitled account
AND users have navigated to a live streamed game (Preview and In Progress states), for the team entitled to the account
custom_steps: WHEN the user signs in with their monthly entitled account
custom_expected: THEN users will be able to access the stream

title: Sign On - Audio Only
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has a Audio only entitled account
AND users have navigated to a audio feed
custom_steps: WHEN the user signs in with their Audio only entitled account
custom_expected: THEN users will be able to access the stream

title: Sign On - Non Entitled Account
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has logged in with a Non-Entitled Account
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to a Free Game of the Week Stream
custom_expected: THEN the user can access the stream.

title: Sign On - In Market Streaming
custom_preconds:
GIVEN users have logged in with a MLB.tv entitled account
AND users navigate to a In Market Stream (PIT, SEA, COL, HOU)

Wiki Reference: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/FED/ROOT+Sports+2018+Relaunch#ROOTSports2018Relaunch-Front-EndGoodness
custom_steps:
WHEN users open the stream
AND the users go through the login flow
custom_expected:
THEN users will see an activate page with a tv provider dropdown
AND users will get redirected to the tv provider dropdown
AND users will be able to access the stream.

title: Sign On - MLB.com
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has a valid MLB.tv account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user signs into their MLB.tv account on MLB.com
AND users navigate to a MLB.tv live stream/archived stream
custom_expected: THEN users should be able to access the stream without having to sign in again.

title: Blackout Messaging
custom_preconds: GIVEN Users have logged into a valid MLB.tv account
custom_steps:
WHEN users navigate to a game that is blacked out nationally or locally
AND the user clicks the video to start playback
custom_expected:
THEN users will see a message drop down from the top of the page that states:
"Unable to launch the requested content. Please refresh your page.
If your problems persist please:
1. Clear your browser cookie for this page and relaunch the MLB.TV Media Player.
2. Select another live or archived game and try again"

title: Upgrade Messaging
custom_preconds: GIVEN Users have logged into a free MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN users navigate to a game that is isn't a Facebook Game of the Week OR a Free Game of the Week
AND the user clicks the video to start playback
custom_expected:
THEN users will see a message drop down from the top of the page that states:
"Unable to launch the requested content. Please refresh your page.
If your problems persist please:
1. Clear your browser cookie for this page and relaunch the MLB.TV Media Player.
2. Select another live or archived game and try again"

title: Single Team Messaging
custom_preconds: GIVEN Users have logged into a Single Team MLB.tv Account
custom_steps:
WHEN users navigate to a game that isn't a free game of the week or a facebook game of the week or a team in the single team package
AND the user clicks the video to start playback
custom_expected:
THEN users will see a message drop down from the top of the page that states:
"Unable to launch the requested content. Please refresh your page.
If your problems persist please:
1. Clear your browser cookie for this page and relaunch the MLB.TV Media Player.
2. Select another live or archived game and try again"

title: Play/Pause

custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the Pause/Play button
custom_expected: THEN the video should Pause/Play accordingly

AND clicks on the MLB.tv icon a Live game
AND is redirected to MLB.TV video page appropriately with content playback
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks Rewind 10

title: Clubs | Club URL Behavior
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has navigated to the VPP
AND the Link has a club name in it
Ex: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/mets/video
custom_steps: WHEN the page loads
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see
1. Team logo in the top-left
2. "Back to [teamname].com" text in the top-left
3. Clicking a tag should keep /teamname/ in the URL (Ex: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/mets/video/search/tag/Midseason%20Report)
4. Entering a search should keep /teamname/ in the URL (Ex: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/mets/video/search?q=Midseason+Report)
5. Clicking a playlist carousel should keep /teamname/ in the URL (Ex: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/mets/video/recap-nym-6-stl-5/c-1587806183?tid=8878556)
6. Clicking a playlist from the dropdown should keep /teamname/ in the URL (Ex: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/mets/video/t-19005548)

title: Social Sharing
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the VPP
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to share an asset
custom_expected:
THEN the user will get the following behavior
- Facebook: Opens new window, asking user to post the video link and metadata
- Twitter: Opens new window, asking user to post the link
- Email: Opens a blank tab (known bug), then email application with the title and a link to the video
- Embed Link: <iframe src='https://www.mlb.com/video/share/statcast-judges-line-drive-hr/c-1571091183?tid=6479266' width='540' height='360'></iframe>
- Copy Link: https://www.mlb.com/video/statcast-judges-line-drive-hr/c-1571091183?tid=6479266

Known issues
- Overlap on Embed/Copy Sharing: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WMI-2471
- Email share puts content below your signature: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WMI-2561
 
![](index.php?/attachments/get/17190)

custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is logged in
AND selects an archived and/or VOD (video on demand) feed from Media Center
ie: https://www.mlb.com/live-stream-games

AND user clicks on the back arrow next to the date to view previous day's games
AND clicks on the blue link next to the MLB.tv icon 
AND is redirected to MLB.TV video page appropriately with content playback
custom_steps:
WHEN the user hovers within the player, they will see the following player controls
(Standard - Play/pause, back 10 secs, volume control)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/19579)


WHEN the user clicks the volume icon
custom_expected: THEN the volume icon will display a small x (muted) and none when unmuted.

title: Video Tags return related Tag results
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the VPP watching content
https://beta-aws.milb.com/video/express-top-10-plays-5/c-1868535583
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks a tag
Ex: Pacific Coast

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19345)
custom_expected:
THEN the tag link will return related search results for that tag
Ex: https://beta-aws.milb.com/video/search/tag/pacific_coast

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19346)

title: Search again from a Tag URL
custom_preconds:
Related Jira: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WMI-2607

GIVEN the user is on a search tag URL
Ex: https://beta-aws.milb.com/video/search/tag/pacific_coast
custom_steps: WHEN the user enters a keyword search on the page link above
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see search results related to that keyword
AND the user should NOT see search results related to that tag from the URL

title: Search Results | Scrolling to the bottom loads 20 more results
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on a search page of the VPP
Tag Ex: https://beta-aws.milb.com/video/search/tag/pacific_coast
custom_steps: WHEN the user scrolls down to the bottom of the first 20 results
custom_expected:
THEN 20 more results will load in
AND then scrolling down will trigger another 20 results
AND the "results found" counter at the top-left of the page should update appropriately

title: Search returns related search results
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is on the VPP
AND the user enters a keyword search
Ex: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/video/search?q=dinger
custom_steps: WHEN a search is returned
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the following:
"Search Video" in the search control (right side)
"Search results for: dinger" under the heading (left side)
"20 of x results found" under the heading (left side)

AND clicking a result will play that media


![](index.php?/attachments/get/19347)

title: Search Results | Return TopicID where necessary **
custom_preconds:
Related Jira: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WMI-2555

GIVEN a user enters a search result
AND that result brings VTP and non-VTP related results
Ex: https://beta-aws.milb.com/video/search?q=dinger
custom_steps: WHEN the user copies the link of the results
custom_expected:
1. IF the asset is related to a VTP
THEN the user will see ?tid=vtp_some_name_like_this
AND ?q= will be removed
Ex: Look for "HRD Rd2: Sanchez slugs 485-foot homer in Round 2"
Result: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/video/c-1597904483?tid=vtp_hrd_sponsor
![](index.php?/attachments/get/17170)

2. IF the asset isn't related to a VTP
THEN the user will not see ?tid= added, just ?q=
Ex: Look for "NYM@STL: Voit goes opposite-field for a solo home run"
Result: https://beta-aws.mlb.com/video/c-1593618683?q=dinger
![](index.php?/attachments/get/17171)


Some VTP parameter examples below
?tid=vtp_hrd_sponsor > 2017 T-Mobile Home Run Derby (topicID=187525564)
?tid=vtp_club_top_play > Indians Top Plays (topicID=220572662)
?tid=vtp_transactions > On The Move (topicID=33965510)
?tid=vtp_top_performer > #ASGWorthy (topicID=155065792)
?tid=vtp_power > Papa Slams (topicID=82574482)

title: "Search Video" ghost text disappear as user starts to enter text in the search field.
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the VPP
custom_steps: WHEN user click on the search field and starts to type in any word
custom_expected:
THEN the ghost text "search videos" disappears
AND when the entry is erased, the ghost text reappears

title: MiLB Portal Styling
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has navigated to www.milb.com
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the video player page
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the MiLB Portal page styling

title: League Portal Styling
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has navigated to www.milb.com
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the video player page
AND the user adds the league designation into the url: https://www.milb.com/{League Designation}/video/{Name of Video}/c-{Content ID}?tid={Topic ID}
i.e: https://www.milb.com/international/video/carrolls-diving-catch/c-2524448883?tid=263548762

a list of league designations are located at: https://prod-aws.milbstatic.com/configs/clubs.json
custom_expected: THEN users will see the styling of the league the user selects

title: Team Portal Styling
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has navigated to www.milb.com
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the video player page
AND the user adds the teams location designation into the url: https://www.milb.com/{Team Location Designation}/video/{Name of Video}/c-{Content ID}?tid={Topic ID}
i.e: https://www.milb.com/durham/video/carrolls-diving-catch/c-2524448883?tid=263548762

a list of league designations are located at: https://prod-aws.milbstatic.com/configs/clubs.json
custom_expected: THEN users would see the team styling of their choice.
